title: Large-Scale Augmented Reality-Based Digital Media Art Creation and Scientific Inquiry Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool usage, understanding of artistic expression techniques, and scientific observation and hypothesis formulation abilities
context.additional_context: Provides an augmented reality content creation environment for individual student creative activities. Emphasizes sharing learning outcomes through digital media art exhibitions and scientific inquiry processes (observation, measurement, analysis, conclusion derivation).

learning_goals: Students can explain how to arrange visual elements in 3D space according to scientific principles using augmented reality tools.
Design and analyze experiments to enhance the visual impact of digital media artworks by over 20% through the addition of interactive features.
Teams can exhibit completed projects in a virtual reality gallery, collect feedback, and evaluate the scientific and artistic effectiveness of the works.

resources: AR Development Kit (ZigSpace, Merge Cube, etc.)
Digital Art Creation Software (CoSpaces Edu, Tilt Brush)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
